content.description: Reaction Chemical Equation <math alttext="K sub e q" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></math> 1 <math alttext="H A aqueous is in equilibrium with H with a positive 1 charge aqueous plus A with a negative 1 charge aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>HA</mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>⇄</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="K sub 1 equals 0.010" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.010</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> 2 <math alttext="H 2 B aqueous is in equilibrium with H with a positive 1 charge aqueous plus H B with a negative 1 charge aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>B</mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>⇄</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>HB</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="K sub 2 equals 0.000010" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.000010</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> The table above provides the <math alttext="K sub e q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> values for two reactions. Which of the following is the correct mathematical expression needed to determine the equilibrium constant of the reaction shown below?

choices.label: <math alttext="K sub 3 equals K sub 1 times the fraction 1 over K sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>1</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>×</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="K sub 3 equals K sub 1 minus K sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>1</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>2</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.A: Identify quantities needed to solve a problem from given information (e.g., text, mathematical expressions, graphs, or tables).
